title: Winter Olympics 2026: Dual cauldrons lit in historic first, inspired by Leonardo da Vinci
desc: Find out more about the two cauldrons, lit and to be extinguished in perfect synchrony at Milano Cortina 2026.

title: Legal Malaysians living in fear in Minnesota
desc: PETALING JAYA: For Sarah Ng, a 30-year-old Malaysian professional living in southern Minneapolis, a major city in the state of Minnesota, for the past decade, her daily routine was simple: driving to work and back home.

title: SpaceX's next astronaut launch for NASA is officially on for Feb. 11 as FAA clears Falcon 9 rocket to fly again
desc: The FAA has cleared the Falcon 9 rocket to return to flight, freeing NASA and SpaceX to target Feb. 11 for the launch of the Crew-12 astronaut mission to the International Space Station.

title: Mystery as boy, 5, finds rare sea creature on popular UK beach
desc:
A RARE sea creature has been found by a little boy on a popular UK beach.
The adventurous five-year-old stumbled up the "alien-like" animal...

title: Analogue's N64 Console Gets Prototype Editions in Colors Nintendo Buried 30 Years Ago
Halle Berry Confirms Her Engagement to Van Hunt
desc: The actress and producer confirmed her engagement on “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon,” unveiling an heirloom-style ring.

title: ‘Train Dreams’ Brazilian Cinematographer Adolpho Veloso Talks Oscar Nominations
desc: Adolpho Veloso, the Brazilian director of photography for ‘Train Dreams,’ tells Deadline's Baz Bamigboye how Brazilians are celebrating its Oscar Nominations.

title: Lil Jon's son Nathan Smith, a.k.a. DJ Young Slade, dead at 27
desc: Rapper Lil Jon's son Nathan Smith was found dead Friday in a Georgia park pond after going missing Tuesday morning. The 27-year-old performed as DJ Young Slade.

title: Smaller Quantum Computers Become Reality With New Frequency-Based Beam Splitter Designs
desc: Researchers have designed frequency-selective beam splitters using coupled resonators, offering a potentially more efficient and scalable approach to building quantum computers by reducing the hardware needed for error correction.

title: Ireland XV overpowered by England 'A' at Thomond Park
desc: A tough 24 hours for Irish rugby continued as Ireland XV lost 52-14 to England 'A' in their representative fixture at Thomond Park.
